Vector Direction

Description

Compute the Cartesian directions associated with the components (or scalar projections) of vectors.

Usage

direction.xy ( xy )

Argument Description
xy A data.frame with at least two columns. The first two columns should be numeric.

Value

A vector, one element per row of the argument. Each element specifies the direction—in radians—associated with the corresponding row of the argument.

Examples 

#EXAMPLE 1

ppkg <- "file-path-to-the-protopackage--WITHOUT-final-path-separator"
error <- tryCatch (
    expr =
        {
            direction.xy <- source ( paste0 (
            ppkg , "/inst/extdata/R/0/direction.xy/1.R") ) [[ 1 ]]
            FALSE
        } ,
    error = function ( e ) TRUE )
if ( error ) {
    message (
        "Did you forget to define ppkg, the path to this protopackage?" )
} else {
    xy <- data.frame (
        x = c( +1 , +1 ,  0 , -1 , -1 , -1 ,  0 , +1 ) ,
        y = c(  0 , +1 , +1 , +1 ,  0 , -1 , -1 , -1 ) )
    cat ( "\n\n\n" )
    print ( xy )
    plot ( xy , col = NA )
    text ( xy , labels = seq_len ( nrow ( xy ) ) , font = 2, col = "red" )
    d <- direction.xy ( xy )
    xydd <- cbind ( xy , rad = d , deg = d * 180 / pi )
    xydd <- cbind ( xydd , deg360 = xydd $ deg %% 360 )
    cat ( "\n\n\n" )
    print ( xydd )
    plot ( xy , col = NA )
    h <- 0.9
    s <- 1 / sqrt ( 2 )
    segments ( x0= 0 , y0 = -h , y1 = h )
    segments ( y0= 0 , x0 = -h , x1 = h )
    segments ( y0= -h , x0 = -h , x1 = +h , y1 = +h )
    segments ( y0= +h , x0 = -h , x1 = +h , y1 = -h )
    text ( xy , labels = xydd $ deg360 , font = 2, col = "red" )
}


#EXAMPLE 2 (simpler, no errror checking)
ppkg <- "~"
direction.xy <- source ( paste0 ( ppkg ,
    "/inst/extdata/R/0/direction.xy/1.R") ) [[ 1 ]]
DF1 <- as.data.frame ( matrix ( ncol = 2 , data = runif ( 16 ) ) )
cbind ( DF1 , d = direction.xy ( DF1 ) )
